EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────
### Extraction System at Position(x = -3.5, y = 27.5)
Consists of a dedicated burner inserter whose drop point is at Position(x = -3.5, y = 28.5). Its role is to receive materials from the extraction process and feed them into the belt‐network.

### Copper Cable Factory at Approximately Position(x = 2.5, y = 17.5)
Consists of:
– A cable input chest located at Position(x = 2.5, y = 17.5)
– A burner inserter placed at Position(x = 3.5, y = 17.5) (used with direction RIGHT)
– An additional burner inserter at Position(x = 1.5, y = 17.5) (fuelled with coal)
– A further burner inserter at Position(x = 2.5, y = 16.5) (oriented UP)
– An assembling machine at Position(x = 1.5, y = 19.5)
This structure is designed to process inputs for the production of copper cable through seamless transfer between its components.

### Belt Depot at Position(x = 3.5, y = 15.5)
Consists of:
– A wooden chest placed at Position(x = 3.5, y = 15.5) serving as the depot basis
– An adjacent transport belt segment at Position(x = 4.5, y = 15.5)
– A depot burner inserter positioned at Position(x = 3.5, y = 14.5) whose pickup aligns with the chest
This depot serves as an isolated belt target, intended to collect items from the extraction system before routing them onward.

### Electricity Generator at Position(x = -0.5, y = 24.5)
Consists of:
– A steam engine (generator) at Position(x = -0.5, y = 24.5)
– A boiler at Position(x = -5.5, y = 24.0)
– An offshore pump at Position(x = -7.5, y = 25.5)
This grouping provides electrical power by converting water into steam that drives the generator.

ERROR TIPS
──────────
• Belt Connection Errors
  – When connecting transport belts, never target a SteamEngine directly. Always introduce an inserter that inputs items into the SteamEngine so that belts are connected to a valid target.

• Placement Distance Issues
  – Before placing an entity (for example, a wooden chest), ensure the player is within the allowed maximum distance of the target position to avoid placement failures.

• Undefined Variable Problems
  – Verify that all variables (such as the reference for target_chest) are properly defined and consistently referenced to avoid NameError exceptions.

• Inventory Shortages
  – Check that the required entity (for instance, wooden-chest) is present in the inventory before attempting a placement action.
